title: Saptashrungi Temple
subtitle: Abode of Goddess Saptashrungi Nivasini in the Sahyadris
overview: The Saptashrungi Temple, located near Vani in Nashik district, is one of Maharashtra’s most venerated Shakti Peethas. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Saptashrungi Nivasini — the seven-hill goddess — believed to be an incarnation of Goddess Durga.

Perched on a hill surrounded by seven mountain peaks, the temple attracts lakhs of devotees every year, especially during Navratri and Chaitra Poornima. The idol of the goddess, carved from a rock and smeared with sindoor, is considered self-manifested (Swayambhu).
According to legend, it was at this very site that Goddess Durga killed the demon Mahishasura, marking it as a symbol of divine strength and victory of good over evil.

highlights.title: One of the Shakti Peethas
highlights.description: Saptashrungi is among Maharashtra’s three and a half Shakti Peethas, representing immense divine energy.

highlights.title: Hilltop Pilgrimage
highlights.description: Located atop a scenic mountain range with 510 steps leading to the temple, offering panoramic views of the Sahyadris.

geography.intro: Nestled in the Sahyadri range, the Saptashrungi Temple stands at an elevation of about 1,230 meters near the town of Vani in Nashik district.

climate.description: The region experiences moderate weather, with cool winters and pleasant monsoons, making it ideal for pilgrimage and trekking.

seasons.text: Monsoon: Lush greenery surrounds the temple (June–September)
Winter: Best time for comfortable travel (November–February)

geography.conclusion: With its divine aura and mountain backdrop, Saptashrungi Temple offers both a spiritual and natural retreat.

activities.title: Darshan and Pooja
activities.description: Seek blessings of Goddess Saptashrungi through daily rituals and special aartis.
info: Morning aarti starts at 5:30 AM and evening aarti at 7:00 PM.
Special poojas during Navratri and Chaitra festivals.

activities.title: Trek to the Temple
activities.description: Devotees climb 510 steps to reach the temple situated on the hilltop.
info: Ropeway facility available for devotees unable to climb.
Enjoy panoramic views of the Sahyadri hills during ascent.

activities.title: Explore Nearby Hills
activities.description: The surrounding hills are perfect for short treks and nature walks.
info: Ideal for early morning or evening walks.
Offers beautiful viewpoints of the temple and valley below.

attractions.title: Sacred Steps of Saptashrungi
attractions.description: The flight of 510 steps leading to the shrine is believed to cleanse devotees of sins.

attractions.title: Vani Town
attractions.description: A small town at the base of the hill, famous for local shops selling coconuts, sindoor, and offerings to the goddess.

marineLife.intro: While Saptashrungi has no marine connection, its spiritual energy and mountain serenity offer a different kind of life force.

items.title: Divine Energy
items.description: Devotees feel immense peace and rejuvenation in the temple’s sacred environment.

items.title: Nature’s Harmony
items.description: The temple’s location amidst seven peaks symbolizes unity and natural balance.

conclusion: Saptashrungi combines divinity with the beauty of the Sahyadris.
It remains one of Maharashtra’s most spiritually uplifting pilgrim destinations.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Nashik Road (70 km).
Regular trains connect Nashik to Mumbai, Pune, and other major cities.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Regular buses available from Nashik, Vani, and Kalwan to the temple base.
Private taxis and jeeps can be hired for hilltop access.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Nashik Airport (60 km) and Mumbai International Airport (230 km).
Cabs and buses available from both airports to Vani.

gallery.alt: Aerial view of temple and Sahyadris

bookingTips.description: Use the ropeway for quicker access during crowded festival days.
Carry water and light snacks as the climb can be tiring.
Accommodation is available at temple guesthouses and nearby lodges in Vani.
